Ron Darling and Keith Hernandez have both had long and successful careers in baseball, and they have worked together as broadcasters for the New York Mets for many years. While they share a deep knowledge and love of the game, they do have some differences in their views and perspectives.

One area where they often disagree is in their approach to modern baseball analytics. Keith is known for being a more old-school player and analyst, who places a lot of emphasis on traditional statistics and the "eye test." He often expresses skepticism about newer metrics like launch angle and exit velocity, and he prefers to rely on his own observations and experience.

Ron, on the other hand, is more open to using advanced statistics and data analysis to evaluate players and teams. He has written and spoken extensively about the importance of analytics in modern baseball, and he often incorporates these metrics into his commentary.

Despite these differences, Ron and Keith do share a lot of common ground in their approach to the game. Both are deeply knowledgeable about baseball history and strategy, and they both have a strong understanding of the nuances of the game. They both appreciate the importance of fundamentals, like good defense and smart baserunning, and they both value the mental and emotional aspects of the game, like the importance of team chemistry and mental toughness.

Overall, while Ron and Keith may have some differences in their views on baseball, they share a deep love and respect for the game and a commitment to bringing their expertise and insights to Mets fans.
